subdefinitions.definition: To take a small , quick bite , or several of such bites, of (something).
To lightly bite (a person or animal , or part of their body ), especially in a loving or playful manner ; to nip .
To make (a hole in something) through small bites.
To make (one's way ) through or while taking small bites.
examples: Before he realized it, he had nibbled his way through a whole bag of potato chips.
The cows nibbled their way across the field.

subdefinitions.definition: Chiefly followed by into or to : to cause (something) to be in a certain state through small bites.

Followed by away , off , etc. : to remove (something) through small bites. To remove (small pieces ) from glass , tile , etc., with a tool ; also, to remove small pieces from (glass, tile, etc.) with a tool.
To fidget or play with (something), especially with the fingers or hands . ( slang ) To catch (someone); to nab . ( slang ) To steal (something); to pilfer .
Chiefly followed by at , away , or on : to take a small, quick bite, or several of such bites; to eat (at frequent intervals ) with small, quick bites.
examples: The rabbit nibbled at the lettuce.

subdefinitions.definition: To lightly bite, especially in a loving or playful manner.
examples: He nibbled at my neck and made me shiver.

subdefinitions.definition: Chiefly followed by at : to show slight interest in something, such as a commercial opportunity or a proposal . Followed by away at : to reduce or use up gradually ; to eat. ( cricket , informal ) Followed by at : of a batter : to make an indecisive attempt to bat a ball bowled outside the off stump . ( road transport ) Synonym of tramline ( “ of a vehicle : to tend to follow the contours of the ground with its wheels ” ) .
To fidget or play, especially with the fingers or hands. Chiefly followed by at : to make insignificant complaints ; to carp , to cavil , to find fault . ( slang ) To engage in sexual intercourse .
